page.title: 01General Description
page.content:
O.S. Map Grid no. 06240285
This area covers most of the parish of Alburgh and a little of the parish of Redenhall near Harleston in Norfolk. The community is tied very closely to the land with agriculture being the main industry. Many fakilies have lived in the area for four or five generations and know the fields, buildings, flora and fauna as well as their own families. There are a number of scattered dwellings, originally farm houses and cottages among the fields with the village of Alburgh providing the only close community. Household shopping is done generally in Harleston or Bungay 4 miles away with Norwich serving the community as the major town.
